intro: Nototriche cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive hairy texture. Nototriche cavanillesii is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations.
